Singly Linked List On Leetcode.com

Overview

  • Introduction
    • 2. Add Two Numbers
    • 19. Remove Nth Node From End of List
    • 21. Merge Two Sorted Lists
    • 24. Swap Nodes in Pairs

Introduction

This part is about operations on singly linked list. Questions are copied from Leetcode.com and sorted by the question numbers. Solutions are designed and programed by Yao Yu.

2. Add Two Numbers

Difficulty: Medium

You are given two linked lists representing two non-negative numbers. The digits are stored in reverse order and each of their nodes contain a single digit. Add the two numbers and return it as a linked list.

Sample:

Input: (2 -> 4 -> 3) + (5 -> 6 -> 4)
Output: 7 -> 0 -> 8

Solution:

19. Remove Nth Node From End of List

Difficulty: Easy

Given a linked list, remove the n-th node from the end of list and return its head.

Sample:

Given linked list: 1->2->3->4->5, and n = 2.
After removing the second node from the end, the linked list becomes 1->2->3->5.

Solution:

21. Merge Two Sorted Lists

Difficulty: Easy

Merge two sorted linked lists and return it as a new list. The new list should be made by splicing together the nodes of the first two lists.

Solution:

24. Swap Nodes in Pairs

Difficulty: Medium

Given a linked list, swap every two adjacent nodes and return its head.

Sample:

Given 1->2->3->4, you should return the list as 2->1->4->3.

Note:

Your algorithm should use only constant space. You may not modify the values in the list, only nodes itself can be changed.

Solution:
